channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Eaton Fire forced them from their homes. Here's what residents took with them
item.description: Many residents in Altadena, Calif., evacuated not knowing it would be the last time they would see their homes standing. Their decisions about what possessions to take were rushed — or not made at all.
item.content:encoded:
Many residents in Altadena, Calif., evacuated not knowing it would be the last time they would see their homes standing. Their decisions about what possessions to take were rushed — or not made at all.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Trump calls on the federal government to recognize North Carolina's Lumbee Tribe
item.description: President Trump made good on a campaign promise to ask the Department of the Interior to recognize the Lumbee people of North Carolina — a tribe whose Native identity has long been called into question.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump made good on a campaign promise to ask the Department of the Interior to recognize the Lumbee people of North Carolina — a tribe whose Native identity has long been called into question.

(Image credit: Chris Seward)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Hamas releases 4 more hostages as part of ceasefire agreement with Israel
item.description: Four female soldiers taken hostage on Oct. 7, 2023 by Hamas were handed over to the International Committee of the Red Cross in Gaza on Saturday morning, and then transferred to the Israeli military.
item.content:encoded:
Four female soldiers taken hostage on Oct. 7, 2023 by Hamas were handed over to the International Committee of the Red Cross in Gaza on Saturday morning, and then transferred to the Israeli military.

(Image credit: Omar Al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Jerome Socolovsky

item.title: 5 money-draining mistakes travelers make when planning a vacation
item.description: People get a lot wrong when it comes to paying for vacation, say travel experts, and that can cost serious cash. Here's how to plan a trip that's safe, adventurous and under budget.
item.content:encoded:
People get a lot wrong when it comes to paying for vacation, say travel experts, and that can cost serious cash. Here's how to plan a trip that's safe, adventurous and under budget.

(Image credit: Photograph by Tsering Bista and Beck Harlan)
item.dc:creator: Amelia Edelman

item.title: Pete Hegseth, Trump's embattled pick for defense secretary, wins Senate confirmation
item.description: Vice President J.D. Vance cast a tie-breaking vote as Hegseth overcame allegations of sexual assault, public drunkenness and questions of financial mismanagement to win Senate approval.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President J.D. Vance cast a tie-breaking vote as Hegseth overcame allegations of sexual assault, public drunkenness and questions of financial mismanagement to win Senate approval.

(Image credit: Chen Mengtong)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Trump re-enacts policy banning aid to groups abroad that discuss or provide abortions
item.description: The Mexico City Policy cuts off U.S. aid to health groups in other countries that offer abortion services or counseling. As in 2021, Trump has reinstated this policy, which was deactivated by Biden.
item.content:encoded:
The Mexico City Policy cuts off U.S. aid to health groups in other countries that offer abortion services or counseling. As in 2021, Trump has reinstated this policy, which was deactivated by Biden.

(Image credit: Sam Reinders for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Carlson

item.title: U.S. puts virtually all foreign aid on 90-day hold, issues 'stop-work' order
item.description: Following Trump's Monday freeze on foreign aid, a subsequent memo calls for for a stop-work order for current grants and contracts.
item.content:encoded:
Following Trump's Monday freeze on foreign aid, a subsequent memo calls for for a stop-work order for current grants and contracts.

(Image credit: Orlando Sierra/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Arrest warrant proposed for Taliban leaders for gender-based crimes
item.description: The International Criminal Court, a U.N. agency, has to approve the warrants. They've been condemned by the Taliban and welcomed by Afghan women and their advocates — with some reservations.
item.content:encoded:
The International Criminal Court, a U.N. agency, has to approve the warrants. They've been condemned by the Taliban and welcomed by Afghan women and their advocates — with some reservations.

(Image credit: Wakil Kohsar/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ruchi Kumar

item.title: UnitedHealthcare names new CEO after Brian Thompson's killing
item.description: The largest U.S. insurer promoted company executive Tim Noel to replace Thompson, whose death sparked a national outcry over the health care industry.
item.content:encoded:
The largest U.S. insurer promoted company executive Tim Noel to replace Thompson, whose death sparked a national outcry over the health care industry.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Her brother was supposed to enter the U.S. as a refugee. That's on hold now.
item.description: This week the Trump administration suspended the country's refugee resettlement program, leaving thousands of people – who had been cleared and scheduled to come to the U.S. – in a limbo.
item.content:encoded: This week the Trump administration suspended the country's refugee resettlement program, leaving thousands of people – who had been cleared and scheduled to come to the U.S. – in a limbo.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse
